text:
Getting a console error on a clients site - This looks like a HubSpot script. Any ideas on how I can fix this?

Refused to execute script from ‘<https://www.getencircle.com/hs/cta/ctas/v2/public/cs/cta-loaded.js?pid=4633569&pg=448a13ed-cf27-4ad6-ae1e-ce8f6d7b1d87&lt=1690357699083&dt=1690357699085&at=1690357699761&ae=1&an=1>’ because its MIME type (‘’) is not executable, and strict MIME type checking is enabled.

Hi, hoping you could help. We need multiple env. for development purposes:
• Acceptation, for client delivery and beta testing (current enterprise sandbox of plan)
• Staging, for internal QA
• Local, for every developer to work on locally
Acceptation is linked with Github actions (HS best practices), this makes is not suiteable as a live development env. because every code change needs a github push in order to become available on the HS. Imagine sending an email for every text line you type on slack .

*Is it not possible to open up those permission for at least the local env. of the B/E dev working on this module?*

Question for the group... I'm migrating a site from one HubSpot account to another. It won't let me connect the domain until the domain has been removed from the original account. Wondering if HubSpot frees up the domain instantly or if I'm going to experience some down time waiting for it to register that the domain has been freed up?

There could always be downtime. I would setup the new hub with a subdomain. Then you should end up with 2 identical hubs. Then plan to switch over at the last step. This overlap should prevent downtime.
Doesn't let you add the subdomain to the new hub until it's been removed from the previous.
That said it worked fine and HubSpot released the domain from the older account pretty much instantaneously
Pretty rare to migrate from HubSpot CMS to HubSpot CMS... Luckily it went really smooth

:HubSpotheart:*Help your fellow HubSpot Developers!*:HubSpotheart:

This Slack lives and breathes by its community. If you're posting a question, take a moment and click around a few channels to see if there are any questions you can help answer. Instant karma!

Hello all — I'm relatively new to the world of HubSpot and need to perform a split URL test between two completely different variations of a homepage. Since the two variations are extremely different, I don't think the internal A/B testing tool is sufficient. Can anyone point me to some good resources that would help enable me to do this?

Also, if there's a better channel to drop this in, please let me know! Thanks!

Does anyone have any strong opinions on Person accounts in Salesforce when it comes to the Salesforce and HubSpot integration? Any horror or success stories about using it over the traditional Lead/Contact/Account structure?

We’re a business with both strong B2B and B2C divisions that Marketing handles out of HubSpot and our leadership team is currently thinking about moving Salesforce to Person accounts.
